author: Franco Dantas
description: Brazil President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva tapped congressman Guilherme Boulos for a key cabinet position, marking an attempt to shore up backing from the left ahead of the 2026 electoral race.
title: Lula Adds Leftist Ally Boulos to Cabinet Ahead of 2026 Race

author: Hadriana Lowenkron
description: The US is weighing imposing new tariffs on imports from Nicaragua or cutting the country off from benefits under a free trade deal, the White House’s Office of the US Trade Representative said in a report Monday.
title: White House Weighs Fresh Nicaragua Tariffs Over Human Rights

author: Georgia Hall, Julie Fine, Joe Mathieu
description: Texas Senator Ted Cruz said that Republicans must take seriously the surge of political energy across the country after millions of people turned out for “No Kings” protests over the weekend opposing President Donald Trump’s agenda.
title: Ted Cruz Warns of 2026 Risk for GOP as Protests Show Voter Anger

author: Ben Otto, Chandra Asmara
description: Indonesian President Prabowo Subianto enters his second year in office facing mounting challenges — tepid economic growth, stubbornly high youth unemployment and a troubled multibillion-dollar free meals program. Now, a new concern looms: slipping voter support, obscured by a lack of credible public polling in his first year.
title: Prabowo Begins Year Two With Cool Indonesia Growth, Silent Polls

author: Mark Schroers
description: Germany needs immigrants to maintain economic momentum and make up for demographic decline, according to Bundesbank President Joachim Nagel.
title: Aging Germany Needs Immigrants, Bundesbank Chief Nagel Says

author: Jennifer A Dlouhy, Kateryna Chursina, Aliaksandr Kudrytski
description: President Donald Trump cast doubt on Ukraine’s ability to defeat Russian forces, backing off an earlier upbeat assessment as he looks to bring the war to an end and prepares for another meeting with President Vladimir Putin in the coming weeks.
title: Trump Casts New Doubt On Ukraine’s Ability to Defeat Russia

author: Nathan R Dean, Romy Varghese
description: Talks on a digital currency bill could bear fruit next year.
title: As the Shutdown Drags On, Democrats Talk With Crypto CEOs

author: Erik Larson
description: Small businesses challenging many of President Donald Trump’s global tariffs urged the US Supreme Court to affirm lower court rulings that the import levies amount to a massive illegal tax on American companies.
title: Supreme Court Is Told Trump Tariffs Are Illegal $3 Trillion Tax

author: Chris Strohm
description: Former FBI Director James Comey moved to dismiss the Justice Department indictment against him, filing motions that he was a victim of a vindictive prosecution by President Donald Trump and challenging the appointment of the prosecutor who brought the case.
title: Comey Moves to Dismiss Justice Department Charges Against Him

author: Erik Wasson, Jamie Tarabay
description: The US Senate will hold off on considering new sanctions legislation on Russia until after President Donald Trump’s planned meeting with Russian President Vladimir Putin, the chamber’s Republican leader said.
title: US Senate to ‘Pause’ Russia Sanctions Bill, GOP Leader Says

author: Erik Larson
description: A US appeals court allowed for now President Donald Trump’s plan to deploy troops to Portland, Oregon, to counter protests against his immigration crackdown, a major boost for the administration’s effort to send the military into Democratic-led cities.
title: Trump’s Portland Troop Deployment Allowed for Now by Appeals Court

author: Ellen Milligan
description: The UK is drawing up new legal powers to swiftly shoot down drones over its military bases, as it warns of “a new era of threat” following Russian incursions into NATO airspace.
title: UK Draws Up New Powers to Shoot Down Drones Over Military Sites

author: Dan Williams, Fadwa Hodali, Jennifer A Dlouhy
description: President Donald Trump said on Monday that the US would destroy Hamas if the militant group didn’t continue to honor the ceasefire with Israel, with a fragile truce resuming after a weekend of heavy fighting in the Gaza Strip.
title: Trump Vows to ‘Eradicate’ Hamas as Fragile Gaza Truce Resumes

author: Stephen Wicary
description: Jamie Dimon will visit Argentina this week as its libertarian president struggles to stave off a run on the peso despite an unprecedented show of support from the US government.
title: Jamie Dimon Heads to Argentina Before Key Test for Milei

author: Donato Paolo Mancini
description: US President Donald Trump’s senior envoy for Arab and African affairs said peace negotiations in Libya and the Democratic Republic of Congo were progressing, and his team was working hard to pursue a ceasefire in Sudan.
title: Peace Talks Progressing in Libya, Congo and Sudan, Senior Trump Advisor Says

author: Jennifer A Dlouhy
description: President Donald Trump says the AUKUS pact between the US, Australia and the UK is “moving along very rapidly,” signaling he’ll allow the Biden-era partnership to go ahead eve as his administration reviews whether to keep it going.
title: Trump Says AUKUS Deal Is Proceeding ‘Rapidly’ in Boost for Pact

author: Donato Paolo Mancini, Andrea Palasciano
description: Italy has expressed readiness to pay for US weapons purchases for Ukraine as part of a special procurement program that’s essential to Kyiv’s efforts to fend off Russia’s full-scale invasion.
title: Italy Signals It’s Ready to Help Ukraine Buy US Weapons

author: Lauren Dezenski, Hadriana Lowenkron
description: US President Donald Trump signed an agreement with visiting Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese to boost access to critical minerals and rare earths as the US looks to reduce reliance on Chinese supply chains.
title: Trump Signs Agreement on Critical Minerals With Australia

author: Gerson Freitas Jr, Skylar Woodhouse, Jonathan Gilbert
description: President Donald Trump vowed to boost beef imports from Argentina as the US faces soaring meat prices, though the increase may provide little relief to American consumers.
title: Trump Eyes Argentina Beef But US Price Relief May Be Limited

author: Georgia Hall
description: Billionaire real estate developer John Catsimatidis urged Curtis Sliwa, the Republican nominee for New York Mayor, to drop out of the race as pressure builds on the Guardian Angels founder to make it easier for Andrew Cuomo to challenge frontrunner Zohran Mamdani.
title: Catsimatidis Joins Ackman Urging Sliwa to End NYC Mayor Bid

author: Zoe Schneeweiss
description: European Central Bank Executive Board member Isabel Schnabel reiterated that the international role of the euro should be enhanced.
title: ECB’s Schnabel Says Euro’s Role Strong, Should Be Strengthened

author: Kamil Kowalcze, Alberto Nardelli
description: The US is balking at a European Union-led plan for Group of Seven nations to expand the use of frozen Russian assets to support Ukraine, according to people familiar with the discussions.
title: US Is Stalling on G-7 Plan to Expand Use of Russian Assets

author: Michael O'Boyle
description: An unprecedented order by the US Treasury to cut off three Mexican financial firms for allegedly helping drug cartels launder funds takes effect Monday. But its impact has already swept through the country’s banking industry.
title: US Finance Ban Takes Effect After Already Crippling Mexico Firms

author: Erik Hertzberg
description: Canada is launching a new financial crimes agency and making changes to banking laws to clamp down on online fraud and other scams.
title: Canada to Start Financial-Crimes Agency to Fight Surge in Online Scams

author: Kamailoudini Tagba
description: An Ivorian soldier was killed days before Oct. 25 elections, when his unit came under attack by unknown gunmen during a patrol early Monday.
title: Ivorian Soldier Shot Dead During Patrol Ahead of Elections

author: Lauren Dezenski, John Harney
description: A top economic adviser to President Donald Trump suggested that “stronger measures” could be in the offing if the government shutdown, now in its 20th day, doesn’t end this week.
title: Trump Adviser Sees ‘Stronger Measures’ If Shutdown Continues

author: Greg Stohr
description: The US Supreme Court agreed to rule on the constitutionality of the federal law that bans firearm possession by drug users and addicts, in a fresh test of the Second Amendment’s gun-rights protections.
title: Supreme Court to Rule on Constitutionality of Drug-User Gun Ban

author: Manuela Tobias
description: Argentina’s central bank and the US Treasury have signed a currency swap line for $20 billion, a key vote of confidence for President Javier Milei ahead of a crucial midterm election on Sunday.
title: US, Argentina Sign $20 Billion Swap Deal Before Midterm Vote

author: Pyotr Kozlov
description: Soybean futures rose for a third consecutive session in Chicago amid speculation that US president Donald Trump and China’s president Xi Jinping could meet in the coming weeks, fueling optimism over renewed agricultural trade between the world’s two largest economies. Prices were also supported by stronger Chinese GDP.
title: Soybeans Climb to Month High on Trump-Xi Meeting Speculation

author: Jacob Lorinc
description: Canadians are increasingly downbeat on the economy as a trade war with the US grinds on, putting pressure on a range of key industries.
title: Canadians Grow Gloomy on the Economy as US Trade War Persists

author: Emily Birnbaum, Erik Wasson
description: Influential conservative groups with deep pockets are pushing Republicans to demand steep concessions from Democrats in exchange for extending health care subsidies, a move that risks prolonging a US government shutdown now in its 20th day.
title: Charles Koch, Anti-Tax Groups Harden GOP’s Tough Shutdown Stance

author: Tarek El-Tablawy, Souhail Karam
description: Morocco is planning to increase next year’s budget for social services, following a wave of youth-led protests against spending for the 2030 FIFA World Cup.
title: Morocco Pledges $15 Billion Social Spending Following Youth-Led Protests

author: Arne Delfs
description: Chancellor Friedrich Merz doubled down on controversial remarks made last week that suggested Germany has too many migrants, as the conservative politician seeks to regain the initiative over the far right.
title: Germany’s Merz Leans Into Far-Right Messaging to Counter AfD

author: Randy Thanthong-Knight
description: Thai Prime Minister Anutin Charnvirakul’s government predicts losses could total 100 billion baht ($3.1 billion) from disruptions to cross-border trade with Cambodia, after a longstanding territorial dispute erupted into armed conflict earlier this year.
title: Thailand Braces for $3.1 Billion Hit From Dispute With Cambodia

author: James Mayger
description: But the Australian premier has a delicate diplomatic dance to perform.
title: Albanese Arrives in the US Bearing Rare-Earth Gifts

author: Ntando Thukwana, Rivaldo Jantjies
description: South Africa’s Democratic Alliance took aim at the country’s Black economic empowerment laws, setting up a clash with the African National Congress with which it serves in an uneasy governing coalition.
title: South Africa’s DA Proposes Bill to End Race-Based Procurement

author: Martin Ritchie
description: China’s shipments of rare-earth magnets to the US and the European Union dropped in September, before Beijing escalated tensions by ramping up export curbs amid stormy trade talks between the world’s top two economies.
title: China’s Rare-Earth Magnet Exports to US Slip Ahead of Trump-Xi

author: Joshua Green, Eliyahu Kamisher
description: Armed with a podcast, a ballot measure and tweets, California’s governor is spoiling for a fight with the president.
title: ‘I Want to Win’: Inside Gavin Newsom’s Plan for Taking On Trump

author: Firat Kozok
description: Turkey’s plan to scrap a withholding tax exemption on certain mutual funds will impact 84 funds managing about 71 billion liras ($2.1 billion), according to an impact analysis reviewed by Bloomberg.
title: Turkey’s Tax Exemption Shift to Hit 84 Equity-Heavy Funds

author: Dan Williams, Fadwa Hodali
description: Israel said it had resumed a truce with Hamas in Gaza after heavy fighting over the weekend, with the sides accusing each other of breaching a deal brokered by US President Donald Trump.
title: Israel Says Gaza Truce Resumes After Deadly Clashes With Hamas

author: Kateryna Chursina, Aliaksandr Kudrytski
description: President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said Budapest wasn’t the best place for talks to end the war in Ukraine because of Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban’s Russia-friendly stance, but he’d still attend if invited.
title: Zelenskiy Slams Budapest as Putin Summit Venue But Says He Would Go

author: Terrence Matthew Edwards
description: Mongolia has been thrown into a political crisis on Monday after President Khurelsukh Ukhnaa vetoed a parliamentary vote to dismiss the prime minister by appealing to constitutional principles and legal procedures.
title: Mongolia Risks Constitutional Crisis as President Vetoes PM Exit

author: Heesu Lee
description: South Korea’s top policy chief said the country made “substantial progress” on most key issues in tariff talks with the US, following a weekend of meetings that also saw Seoul’s top tycoons attend a golf event with Donald Trump at his Mar-a-Lago estate.
title: South Korea Says ‘Substantial Progress’ Made in US Tariff Talks

author: Peter Martin, Ben Westcott, Viktoria Dendrinou, Marcelo Rochabrun, Demetrios Pogkas, Jin Wu
description: Beijing exerts variable degrees of influence over some 90 deepwater ports overseas.
title: China’s Global Network of Shipping Ports Is Too Big for Trump to Unravel

author: Antony Sguazzin, Ntando Thukwana
description: Hit men target professionals who are trying to tackle graft
title: Murder by Appointment: South African Lawyers Face Assassination

author: John Ainger
description: European Union energy ministers aim to agree a joint position on plans to ban all gas supplies from Russia by the end of 2027, as the bloc looks to definitively end its reliance on energy from Moscow.
title: EU Nations Close In on Deal to Ban Russian Gas by End of 2027

author: Sakura Murakami, Alastair Gale
description: Japan’s ruling Liberal Democratic Party has reached a deal with Ishin to form a coalition that will set up Sanae Takaichi to become the country’s first female prime minister, according to a report by national broadcaster NHK.
title: Japan’s LDP Reaches Coalition Deal to Set Up Takaichi as PM: NHK

author: James Mayger
description: Australia’s prime minister is set to pitch his nation’s vast resource holdings as a solution to China’s rare earth curbs at a meeting Monday with President Donald Trump, as the US and other countries scramble to diversify supply of critical minerals.
title: Australia Pitches to Be Trump’s Fix for China Rare Earths Curbs

author: Philip Glamann
description: President Donald Trump said the US will “be fine” with China in comments that come just before the two sides return to the negotiating table and a fragile trade truce nears expiration.
title: Trump Says US Will ‘Be Fine’ With China as Trade Talks Near

author: Alastair Gale
description: Lawmakers in the Japan Innovation Party (Ishin) are set to meet this afternoon to decide whether to form an alliance with the ruling Liberal Democratic Party that would likely lead to Sanae Takaichi becoming the country’s first female prime minister.
title: Japan’s Ishin to Decide Today on Coalition With Takaichi’s LDP

author: Sergio Mendoza
description: Senator Rodrigo Paz won Bolivia’s presidential runoff on Sunday, pledging to repair relations with Washington and curb spending to address the deepest economic crisis in four decades.
title: Pro-Business Senator Paz Wins Bolivia Runoff Amid Economic Chaos
